story.title: Asking for directions in Manchester
story.content:
Asking for directions

Jessica and Luke are at Urbis, Manchester's museum of city life. But where is Lena?

Text message on Lena's phone: "Where R U? U R L8!"

Lena asks for directions

Lena: Excuse me. How do I get to the Urbis museum?
Woman: Um. Let me see. You go straight on into Market Street. Then you take the second left into Cross Street. Go straight on. Urbis is on the left near Exchange Square. You can't miss it! It's a big glass triangle!
Lena: Thank you very much.

Phrases2know – Asking for directions

Excuse me, how do I get to the Urbis museum?
Is the Urbis museum near here?
Can you say that again, please?
Thank you very much.

Phrases2know – Giving directions

Turn left into Market Street.
Turn right into Market Street.
Go straight on.
Take the second left into Cross Street.
Take the third right into Cross Street.
Go down Thomas Street.
Urbis is on the left.
Urbis is on the right.
You can't miss it!

Directions diagrams

1. turn left. 2. turn right. 3. go straight on. 4. take the second left. 5. take the third right. 6. on the left. 7. on the right. 8. go straight on.

An informal note

Jessica's note to Lena

Lena
Let's go to the cinema this afternoon. There's a good film on at the Embassy in Oxford Road. See you at the cinema at 4.00 p.m. Can you come? Send me a text! Here's a map.
Jessica

Phrases2know – Making suggestions

Let's go to the cinema.
Let's watch a DVD.

Where to meet

See you at the cinema.
See you at the Embassy.
See you at my house.
See you in the park.
Let's meet at the cinema.
Let's meet at the Embassy.
Let's meet after school.

Time

See you at four o'clock.
See you at 4.00 p.m.
